bibl.title: Letter from James E. Peabody to Emilie Lawrence Reed, August 29, 1928

div1.p: Peabody thanks Emilie Lawrence Reed for gifts and sends her a copy of a lecture on Walter Reed.

div1.head: Letter from James E. Peabody to Emilie Lawrence Reed, August 29, 1928
div1.opener:
THE MORRIS SERVICE LEAGUE
James E. Peabody, Chairman Teachers Committee
TEL. KILPATRICK 8140
_____
THE MORRIS HIGH SCHOOL
166th Street and Boston Road
NEW YORK CITY
93 Carhart Ave.,
White Plains, N.Y.
Aug. 29, 1928.
Dear Mrs. Reed:-
div1.p:
I wonder if you think it strange that
you have heard nothing from me since
I wrote you briefly in Washington last
April how sorry I was that I could not
take dinner with you. If you read
the enclosed letter to Mrs. Deland you
will understand the reason. It is cer-
tainly is a handicap to have a ner-
vous system that goes on a strike every
now and then, but I suppose it is
partly my fault.

My daughter, who is still a member of
the faculty of the Univ. of Colorado, has
come home for a few weeks to help us
pack up. She shares in my pride in
the possessions of the dear little paper
knife you gave me. When I am thro'
with this more or less useless body of
mine, she will have all treasures of
this sort, for she is deeply interested
in the story I am trying to tell. She has
C1
B12
as her own at the present time the
lovely blue silk gift you sent her.

At last I have tackled again the
museum lecture, 5000 copies of which
are to be printed. I want to get it off
my hands before school opens next
week. Col. Kean has been over it
twice, but he has not seen the pictures. (which I am sending to him
I wish you would look it over, and
make sure there is nothing to which
you object. Please indicate needed
changes & return to me as soon as
possible.

With best wishes to you and your
daughter-
